intro: Tripleurospermum rosellum, commonly known as the Rosell's rayflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with slender stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. Its flower heads are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and grasslands.
